document.docAuthor: Niu, Gengyun, Wei, Meicai, Shinohara, Akihiko & Naito, Tikahiko

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Neocolochelyna Konow

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Claw with inner tooth clearly shorter than outer tooth (
Figs 7
d–i); occipital carina present in lower 0.3 or absent; vein 1 M as long as vein 1 m-cu; cell A of forewing strongly constricted at basal 0.25 , where distance between veins 1 A and 2 A+ 3 A about 2–3 times as broad as 2 A+ 3 A at same position; apex of labrum broadly round (
Figs 4
b, e, h;
Figs 5
b, e, h). Subgenus Curvatapenis Wei........................................................................................... 2

- Claw with inner tooth clearly longer than outer tooth (
Figs 7
a–c); occipital carina present in lower half of hind orbit; vein 1 M clearly shorter than vein 1 m-cu; cell A of forewing weakly constricted at basal 0.25 , where distance between veins 1 A and 2 A+ 3 A about 4–5 times as broad as 2 A+ 3 A at same position; apex of labrum subtriangular (
Figs 3
b, e, h). Subgenus
Neocolochelyna Konow.
...................................................................................... 5

keyStep.keyLead:
2 Mesoscutellum coarsely punctured without interspaces, mat (
Figs 6
g–i); head coarsely punctured or densely rugose, mat, narrow smooth interspaces absent (
Figs 5
a–i); hairs on dorsum of head and mesopleuron very dense, longer than diameter of median ocellus or distinctly curved at apex; at least basal 0.3 of antenna black; distance between antennal sockets as long as distance between antennal socket and inner margin of eye; abdominal tergites 3–7 largely black brown to black, pale posterior margin less than 0.3 times length of tergite, tergite 1 almost entirely black; body length about 13 mm in female and about 10– 12 mm in male........................................................................................ 3

subSubSection.paragraph:
of antenna distinctly paler than apical 0.75 ; distance between antennal sockets clearly shorter than distance between antennal socket and inner margin of eye; abdominal tergites 3–7 narrowly black brown at base, pale posterior stripe not less than 0.6 times length of tergite, broad posterior margin of tergite 1 pale brown; body length: female about 16 mm , male 13–14 mm .. 4
3 Eyes small, distance between them at level of lateral corner of clypeus about 1.3–1.4 times as long as longest axis of eye (
Figs 5
e, 5 h); antenna largely or entirely black, outer side of antennomeres 4–9 with shallow but distinct longitudinal furrow; abdominal tergite 1 with long and dense hairs, surface strongly and densely microsculptured mixed with small and indistinct punctures, mat (
Figs 6
h, i); pale posterior margin of tergites 3–7 about 0.3 times length of tergite; wings almost entirely hyaline; middle fovea indistinct; mesepisternum strongly elevated at middle with a blunt but distinct ridge; ventral half of mesepisternum strongly microsculptured, mat; male: dorsum of abdominal tergite 2 with a large middle black spot (
Fig.
6
i); male: dorsum of abdominal tergite 2 with a large middle black spot (
Fig.
6
i); female: dorsum of abdominal tergite 2 yellow brown without large black spot (
Fig. 6
h), pronotum largely yellow white. China : Hubei, Sichuan....................................................................................................
N. ( C. ) hyalina Niu & Wei
, sp. nov.

paragraph.keyLead:
- Eyes medium sized, distance between them at level of lateral corner of clypeus about 1.1 times as long as longest axis of eye (
Fig. 5
b); apical 0.75 of antenna entirely yellow brown, outer side of antennomeres 4–9 without longitudinal furrow; abdominal tergite 1 with short and sparse hairs, middle area and lateral with some large and deep punctures mixed with microsculpture, surface weakly shiny, not mat (
Fig. 6
g); pale posterior margin of tergites 3–7 less than 0.15 times length of tergite; anterior half of forewing strongly infuscate; middle fovea distinct; mesepisternum hardly elevated at middle, without distinct ridge; ventral half of mesepisternum hardly microsculptured, distinctly shiny; male tergite 2 entirely yellow brown, without black macula dorsally and ventrally (
Fig. 6
g); female unknown. China : Gansu............
N. ( C. ) wui Niu & Wei
, sp. nov.

4 Antennomere 3 1.2 times as long as apical 4 antennomeres together (in male, female unknown); postocellar area flat, lateral furrows of postocellar area shallow and obscure; POL: OOL: OCL= 15 : 40 : 35 (
Fig. 4
a); dorsal hook of penis valve almost straight, middle tubercle of valviceps short and distinctly convex (Fig. 10 c). China : Shaanxi, Henan..................................................................................................
N . ( C. ) testaceoa (
Wei, 2002
)

- Antennomere 3 0.9 times (in male) or 0.8 times (in female) as long as apical 4 antennomeres together; postocellar area distinctly elevated, lateral furrows of postocellar area deep and broad; POL: OOL: OCL= 15 : 25 : 26 (female) or 15 : 29 : 30 (male) (
Figs 4
d, 4g ); dorsal hook of penis valve distinctly curved, middle tubercle of valviceps long and weakly convex (Fig. 10 e). Japan ..........................................................................
N. ( C. ) itoi
Takeuchi, 1951

5 Clypeus with a blunt middle ridge, anterior margin with a distinct middle tooth (
Figs 3
e, 3 h); mesoscutellum about 4 times as long as median length of mesoscutellar appendage, anterior corner obtusely truncate, weakly protruding (
Figs 6
b–c); apex of labrum acute (
Figs 3
e, 3 h); antennomere 3 about 1.1 times as long as antennomeres 6–9 together; eyes small, distance between eyes at level of anterior tentorial pits 1.5 times as long as longest axis of eye in female (
Fig. 3
e); posterior half of frons and upper inner orbit in female yellow brown (
Fig. 3
d); mesepisternum in both sexes black with a distinct yellow brown macula near upper corner; lateral furrows of postocellar area distinctly curved, subparallel in posterior 0.6 (
Figs 3
d, 3g ); posterior margin of postocellar area elevated; apex of inner tibial spur of fore leg very shallowly incised (
Figs 7
k–l); triangular middle lobe of sternite 7 broad and large, much broader than lateral deeply concaved posterior margin of sternite 7 (
Fig. 8
l); lancet as
Fig. 8
d; apical margin of subgenital plate round. China : eastern Tibet..................
N. ( N. ) acutilabria Niu & Wei
, sp. nov.

- Clypeus flat, anterior margin without distinct middle tooth (
Fig. 3
b); mesoscutellum about 6 times as long as median length of mesoscutellar appendage, anterior corner roundly and strongly protruding (
Figs 6
a); apex of labrum narrowly obtuse (
Fig. 3
b); antennomere 3 about 0.9 times as long as antennomeres 6–9 together; eyes large, distance between eyes at level of anterior tentorial pits 1.2 times as long as longest axis of eye in female(
Fig. 3
b); frons and inner orbit in female entirely black (
Fig. 3
a); mesepisternum in female black, without yellow brown macula near upper corner; lateral furrows of postocellar area straight, strongly divergent backwards in entire length (
Fig. 3
a); posterior margin of postocellar area flat; apex of inner tibial spur of fore leg deeply incised (
Fig. 7
j); triangular middle lobe of sternite 7 small, much narrower than lateral straight posterior margin of sternite 7 (
Fig. 8
k); lancet as
Fig. 8
c; apical margin of subgenital plate subtruncate. India : Sikkim...............................................................................................
N. ( N. ) montana (
Konow, 1898
)
